clinical_study.brief_title: Evaluation of Diffusion MRI as a Tool in Planning Deep Brain Stimulation (DBS)
clinical_study.official_title: Evaluation of MRI Based Fiber Tracking as a Tool in Deep Brain Stimulation for Movement Disorders

oversight_info.authority: Denmark: The Regional Committee on Biomedical Research Ethics

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of this study is to explore the relationship between deep brain stimulation implantation site and DTI (diffusion tensor imaging) derived measures for the region and later compare this to the clinical treatment outcomes.

clinical_study.study_design: Observational Model: Case-Only, Time Perspective: Prospective

primary_outcome.measure: UPDRS (unified parkinson disease rating scale) score
primary_outcome.time_frame: patients will be followed from pre-surgical evaluation to 1 year after surgery, roughly 13-14 months

secondary_outcome.time_frame: patients will be followed from per-surgical evaluation to 1 year after surgery, roughly 13-14 months

study_pop.textblock: Patients screened and deemed eligible for treatment with Deep Brain Stimulation

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Deep Brian Stimulation surgery
Exclusion Criteria:
- DBS treatment stopped before 12 month followup
